description: Triangle T(n,k): Write n in base 2, reverse order of digits, to get the n-th row.
comments: This is the quite common, so-called "bittest" function, see Pari code. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 21 2013For a given number m and a digit position k the corresponding sequence index n can be calculated by n(m,k)=m*(1+floor(log_2(m)))-2^(1+floor(log_2(m)))+k+1. For example: counted from right to left, the second digit of m=13 (binary 1101) is '0'. Hence the sequence index is n=n(13,2)=39. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, May 05 2007A070939(n) = length of n-th row; A000120(n) = sum of n-th row; A030101(n) = n-th row seen as binary number; A000035(n) = T(n,0). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 17 2012
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..1023 of triangle, flattened
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: a(n)=floor(m/2^(k-1)) mod 2, where m=max(j|A001855(j)<n) and k=n-A001855(m). - _Hieronymus Fischer_, May 05 2007, Sep 10 2007
